definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: Like lions we tow the line, blood-sewn pact with truth inside.
sentences.chinese: 我們像獅子一樣拖行，血縫製協定真理內。

sentences.english: I specialize in dragging heavy things around cold places.
sentences.chinese: 我特別擅長在寒冷的地方拖行重物。

sentences.english: But first, the textile belt must be built and tested.
sentences.chinese: 但首先，那些紡織拖行帶必須被造出來並經過測試。

sentences.english: That's what it feels like to ride on a sled being pulled by huskies .
sentences.chinese: 這就是坐在由哈士奇拖行的雪橇上的感覺。

sentences.english: Hold the handle and drag to move around.
sentences.chinese: 單手拿著把手，輕鬆拖行，方便移動。

sentences.english: Some barges are pulled by small steamers.
sentences.chinese: 有些駁船是由小汽船拖行的。

definition: to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance
to send or deliver to the hospital
to accelerate/to step on the gas
